critique: The document aims to inspire confidence and hope by addressing the economic crisis. It acknowledges the distress and unemployment but emphasizes the actions taken by Congress to provide relief and protect the general welfare. The creation of the Commodity Credit Corporation is presented as a necessary step to efficiently carry out these actions. The tone is authoritative and decisive, conveying a sense of control and determination to overcome the challenges. The primary emotions the President wants to elicit are joy (relief and hope), and reduced fear and sadness. Surprise and disgust are less relevant in this context.
